Process visualization¶

Description

Base visualization¶

process_vis.base_vis.circle(canvas, center, radius, state_circle, background_circle, outline_circle)¶

This function create a circle in the canvas.

Parameters

  • canvas – Canvas where the circle will be created

  • center (int) – Center of the circle in the canvas

  • radius (int) – Corresponds to the radius of the circle

  • state_circle (boolean) – Displays the the frame of the circle if it takes True

  • background_circle (str) – Choice of the color for the circle’s background

  • outline_circle (str) – Choice of the color for the circle’s lines

process_vis.base_vis.coord(x, y, a, b)¶

Give the coordinnates of the new mark (interger numbers).

Example

>>> coord(200,200,40,60)
(260,160)
process_vis.base_vis.angle_tab(radius, graph)¶

Returns a list of coordinnates which give the angle of each dots, they are proportionally spaced (angle : 2*pi/modulo number).

Parameters

  • radius (int) – Radius of the circle

  • graph – Graph type object

Returns

Returns a list of coordonnates which give the angle of each dots

Return type

list of float

process_vis.base_vis.dot(canvas, graph, radius, center, color_graph, color_name)¶

Add the number of points needed on the cercle thanks to the angle_tab() function.

Parameters

  • canvas – Canvas where the dots will be created

  • graph – Graph type object

  • radius (int) – Corresponds to the radius of the circle

  • center (int) – Center of the circle in the canvas

  • color_graph (list of strings) – It’s about a table of colors of the circle frame

  • color_name (str) – Choice of the color for the numbers placed on the frame of the circle

process_vis.base_vis.name_peak(cnv, radius, graph, center, color_name)¶

Add a number, for each dots, on the frame of the circle.

Parameters

  • cnv – Canvas where the numbers will be added

  • radius (int) – Corresponds to the radius of the circle

  • center (int) – Center of the circle in the canvas

  • color_name (str) – Choice of the color for the numbers placed on the frame of the circle

Edges visualization¶

process_vis.edges_vis.all_edges(canvas, graph, radius, center, color_graph, edges_width)¶

This function reiterates the one_edge() function for every vertex i between 0 and the modulo number - 1.

Parameters

  • canvas – Canvas where edges will be created

  • graph – Graph type object

  • radius (int) – Corresponds to the radius of the circle

  • center (int) – Center of the circle in the canvas

  • color_graph (list of strings) – It’s about a table of colors of the circle frame

  • edges_width (float or int) – The width of ridgs (edges)

process_vis.edges_vis.one_edge(graph, canvas, i, angle, center, color_graph, edges_width)¶

This function draws for any i fixed the edge between the vertex i and the vertex j whitch is given by the result of the modular calculate.

Parameters

  • i (int) – Vertex i

  • j (int) – Vertex j

  • xA,yA (int or float) – Coordinates of the first vertex

  • xB,yB (int or float) – Coordinates of the second vertex

Interface¶

class process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion(speed, state_button, background, state_circle, color_graph, background_circle, outline_circle, color_name, edges_width)¶

This class supports functions which is used, for the graphical interface and link between the different aspects of visualization, as well as the colors and design. It also generates the movement in any canvas or tkinter toplevel.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.__init__(self, speed, state_button, background, state_circle, color_graph, background_circle, outline_circle, color_name, edges_width)¶

This function is a constructor method, that instantiates the speed and all different aspects of the design and movement of the circle.

Parameters

  • speed (float) – Corresponds to the speed of the circle’s movement

  • state_button (boolean) – Show the button if it’s true

  • state_circle (boolean) – Displays the frame of the circle if it takes True

  • color_graph (list of strings) – It’s about a table of colors of the circle frame

  • background_circle (str) – Generates the color of the background of the circle

  • outline_circle (str) – The color of the circle’ lines

  • color_name (str) – The color of the numbers placed on the frame of the circle

  • edges_width (float or int.) – The width of ridgs (edges)

  • nb_frame (int) – The number of images captured for a gif

  • nb_video (int) – The number of video already created

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.design_aspect(self, speed, state_circle, color_graph, background_circle, outline_circle, color_name, edges_width)¶

Initialization of the design aspect parameters.

Parameters

  • speed – Corresponds to the speed of the circle’s movement.

  • state_circle (boolean) – Displays the frame of the circle if it takes True

  • color_graph (list of strings) – It’s about a table of colors of the circle frame

  • background_circle (str) – Generates the color of the background of the circle

  • outline_circle (str) – The color of the circle’ lines

  • color_name (str) – The color of the numbers placed on the frame of the circle

  • edges_width (float or int) – The width of ridgs (edges)

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.window_init(self, background)¶

Initialize the interface’window refers to a rectangular area somewhere on the user’s display screen through which you can interact.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.graph_init(self)¶

This method initializes the graph, as one its radius, its center, as well as its multiplication table and its modulo.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.graph_vis(self)¶

Initialize the visualization part of the graph, concerning its dots and edges.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.table(self, n)¶

This method is the table of n where the value read by the cursor.

Parameters

n (str) – Represent the number in base 10. Like exemple if the cursor is moved switches to position 40; we have a table call (“42”)

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.peak(self, mod)¶

Represents the modulo of the multiplication table and which returns to the peaks of the circle.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.show_update(self)¶

Removes the previous Canvas and recreates a new one.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.slider(self)¶

This method generates the two cursors which captures the number of the table and the number of vertices (modulo). The table cursor captures all tables from 2 to 400, it is placed horizontally and is 250 pixels long. The same for the other cursor of the modulo which represents the number of points (vertices).

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.move_value(self)¶

By this method, we add 0.01 each time we take a value from the multiplication table. We rebuild the movement which is continuous.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.save_frame(self)¶

This method captures the current canvas, converts it to .png format and saves it in the correct directory “/temp/png{number_video}”.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.save_video(self)¶

This method accesses the folder where the corresponding images are saved. Then it creates the gif from the captured images. The latter is saved in the folder “/gif” in the format: gif{number}.gif

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.destroy_root(self)¶

This method deletes all the files whose format is “/temp/png{number_video}”. Then, it destroys all the canvas and closes the window.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.create_table_window(self)¶

This method creates an another window which contains all the modular calculations of the current Canvas. This window is managed by a scrollbar.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.create_description(self)¶

This method creates an another window which contains a description of the different graphicals performances.

process_vis.interface.Interface_gestion.motion_button(self)¶

Provides a button control on the motion graphic and visual, to play or stop the animation.
